SessionREST Resource

Authentication REST service implementation.

POST /session

Authenticate user with an email of auth.email and password of auth.password.

Request Parameters
name type description
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json AuthenticationDTO (JSON) e-mail address and password of the user and whether or not it is an interactive session.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json UserSessionDTO (JSON) A response...generally either a 200 (success) or a 400 (failure).

Request Parameters
name type description
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.

threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

code condition

400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid

404 Object not found

500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type

GET /session/twofactor

Initiate the second factor authentication for the current user who has already authenticated with the first factor (email and password).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id query The ID of the two factor authentication domain the user is authenticating against. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
text/plain (custom) A string response used for 3rd party two factor authentication systems.

POST /session/twofactor

Complete the second factor authentication for the current user who has already authenticated with the first factor (email and password).

Request Parameters
name type description
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json TwoFactorVerificationDTO (JSON) The completed two factor authentication response that needs to be verified.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) Whether the user has successfully met the second factor authentication.
text/plain (custom)
